entry.title: Scalable Notifiers: add IsBrowserContextEligible
entry.content:
Since the initialization of the scalable IPH service is now dependent

on the initialization of some other services, add

`IsBrowserContextEligible` as a substitute check for scalable IPH

availability. If the browser context is eligible, we will assume that

the service will also become available and proceed (i.e. show the

Welcome Tips page in the Explore app after OOBE).



Test: tested manually, existing tests

entry.title: Make offscreen canvas draw calls a no-op when the context is lost
entry.content:
Most canvas API entry points check whether the context is valid by

calling GetOrCreatePaintCanvas and aborting if the returned value is

nullptr. For the HTML canvas element, GetOrCreatePaintCanvas returns

nullptr if the context is lost, therefore making all canvas APIs no-op.

The offscreen canvas version of GetOrCreatePaintCanvas however doesn't

do that. As a result, most offscreen canvas API aren't no-op when the

context is lost.



Adding a check for isContextLost in GetOrCreatePaintCanvas means that

TryRestoreContextEvent can't call that method anymore because this code

runs while the context is lost.



Bug: 1478265

Change-Id: I22247fcf71820dea6e76deb96a19d3cdd3accf44

entry.title: pip2: Elide tail for file URLs
entry.content:
This CL changes document picture-in-picture windows to elide the tail

of the origin display for file URLs, since the file name can be made to

look like an origin for spoofing.



We will continue to elide the head of the origin display for HTTPS

URLs, since origins should be head-elided to prevent spoofing.

entry.title: Support for user-initiated jobs in background task scheduler
entry.content:
1. FGS for downloads/uploads will be soon deprecated and be replaced by

long running jobs. This CL adds support to specify user-initiated job

type in BackgroundTaskScheduler.

2. A notification must be attached to the job life cycle for user-

initiated jobs. This CL adds a callback to the TaskFinishedCallback

interface. This callback could later be changed to TaskCallback.



There are certain constraints when a user- initiated job is specified,

such as it cannot be periodic or have end-time constraints etc. Android

provides run time error messages when such combination is specified.

Hence we add assertions while constructing the TaskInfo.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Robolectric doesn't support Android 14 yet, but will be soon in a few weeks. Tests are in place to run when that's supported.

entry.title: [DSE] Hide Feeds and its header according to DSE.
entry.content:
In this CL, Feeds and its header will be completely hidden if swapping

out NTP is enabled and DSE isn't Google. Therefore, the following

changes are made in FeedSurfaceMediator:

1. Add Pref:EnableSnippetsByDse to track whether the DSE is Google.

2. Once this pref is changed, we hide or show Feeds and its header.

3. Keep an observer of TemplateUrlService even when Feeds isn't

visible. Updates the pref value when DSE is changed.

Demo:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Q6MV5B2Fh79hyt0lbBaYoSO01H7ngxJP/view?usp=drive_link

entry.title: [SurfacePolish] Add new parameter "scrollable_mvt".
entry.content:
The feature flag ShowScrollableMVTOnNTPAndroid has been used

in experiment "Start Surface on Tablet". Thus, we introduce

another parameter for "Surface Polish" feature flag:

1. Phones: use StartSurfaceConfiguration.SURFACE_POLISH_SCROLLABLE_MVT

2. Tablets: always show 1 row MV tiles.

Tis allows us to change the number of rows of MV tiles without

impacted by the ShowScrollableMVTOnNTPAndroid feature.

Screenshot of chrome://flags:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gzbQk_gU2GBRpqNumDsfLVzPbtXzQK4T3RjzDWPgJRo/edit#bookmark=id.qwwfvdt4te43

entry.title: Add nullptr check for `data_source_provider_`
entry.content:
The destruction sequence for HlsDataSourceProvider first calls Stop()

which resets `data_source_provider_`. This also cancels any pending

network requests, but if those network requests have already finished,

then its possible to continue without aborting and potentially

re-entrantly call ReadFromUrl and NPD on `data_source_provider_`

entry.title: Make AXObject::IsKeyboardFocusable use Element::IsKeyboardFocusable
entry.content:
This was previously a re-implementation of Element::IsKeyboardFocusable,

but after recent refactoring, we should just be able to directly use

the Element version.



In implementing this, I found another semi-issue with

IsKeyboardFocusable on a number of element types: it did not take

`tabindex` into account. That wasn't a problem in practice while

navigating with the keyboard, since focus_controller (at [1]) also

looked at the `tabindex` value and took it into account. But that did

mean `IsKeyboardFocusable()` didn't match the actual focusability.

With this change, it does.



This also cleans up the comment around Element::SupportsFocus().

entry.title: Increase minimum check membership delay to 1 hour after device powerwash
entry.content:
The 28DA use case requires a larger amount of time to update the PSM

use case cache, which allows us to retrieve the correct CM response.



In order to correctly get responses for the 28DA CM, increase the

minimum delay before the first check membership from 10 minutes

to 1 hour. This delay is updated for all existing use cases,

including 1DA, churn cohort, and observation.

entry.title: [StyleBuilder] Create ComputedStyle during TakeStyle()
entry.content:
One of the goals of the StyleBuilder project is to allow memory

and performance experiments with different ComputedStyle

representations, and in particular representations made possible

by ComputedStyle being immutable, and created at a single point

in time.



However, until this CL, ComputedStyleBuilder simply held

a ComputedStyle internally for most of its lifetime, and forwarded

all builder calls to that object. This CL removes that internal

ComputedStyle, and creates it during TakeStyle() instead.



The high level explanation of how this works is that

ComputedStyleBuilder[Base] now holds all top-level DataRefs

plus top-level data directly, and simply copies this over

when it's time to create the ComputedStyle.



This requires a fair bit of template tweaks, because:



- All trivial top-level fields are moved to a struct for

performance reasons.

- Our single top-level Member (the BaseData field) needs

special consideration, and is not part of the struct

mentioned above.



Since the main objective of this CL is to remove the internal

ComputedStyle object, I'd be happy with simply *not* regressing

performance. However, we appear to have a small win [1].

This may be because we no longer incur any write barriers

for our top-level DataRefs (now RawDataRefs), even when they're

Accessed post-initialization.



I tried two other approaches:



- Dropping the Data struct (each field existing directly on

ComputedStyle[Builder]Base). This actually had acceptable

performance, though worse than this CL. [2]

- Splitting the Data struct into two structs, inherited

and non-inherited. This allows more reasonable copying

of fields from the inherited and non-inherited sources

(in the two-source constructor of ComputedStyleBuilderBase),

and performance indeed seemed better [3]. However, it

increased the sizeof(ComputedStyle) by eight bytes,

so it's better to make that trade-off separately.



[1] This CL:



50 trial(s) on each side.



Initial style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

=================== ========= ========= ======= =================

ECommerce 5321 5288 +0.6% [ -0.9%, +1.8%]

Encyclopedia 53370 53298 +0.1% [ -1.6%, +1.1%]

Extension 64645 63514 +1.8% [ +0.4%, +2.6%]

News 24231 24166 +0.3% [ -0.5%, +1.0%]

Search 7516 7465 +0.7% [ -0.2%, +1.6%]

Social1 14101 13966 +1.0% [ +0.3%, +1.7%]

Social2 8853 8820 +0.4% [ -0.8%, +1.1%]

Sports 28252 28520 -0.9% [ -2.8%, -0.2%]

Video 21136 21158 -0.1% [ -3.6%, +1.1%]

Geometric mean +0.4% [ -0.3%, +0.9%]



Recalc style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

entry.title: The size-adjust descriptor should not scale system fallback fonts.
entry.content:
When creating a system fallback font for a character on Mac, Blink

refers to the font platform data of the primary font. However, the

created system fallback font could be unintentionally scaled where

the size-adjust descriptor scales the primary font. To fix it, we use

the effective size of the font description instead.



Test: external/wpt/css/css-fonts/size-adjust-unicode-range-system-fallback.html

entry.title: [omnibox][doc] Cleanup doc client scoring and simplify caching.
entry.content:
We ran a bunch of experiments years ago, and were on the fence about

launching. We haven't launched yet, and it's not worth it to revisit it.

So this CL finally removes the client scoring code.



This CL also simplifies caching. Before, the provider had to carefully

add and shrink the cache itself. Now, it sets `max_size` and allows the

cache implementation to handle it. The upside is code simplicity. The

downside is the doc provider may now return duplicate matches when the

cache and newest server response contain the same doc; that's fine,

`AutocompleteResult` will dedupe them later.

entry.title: Yield activation when activation a remote cocoa window on macOS 14.
entry.content:
In macOS 14 an application can't generally activate themselves unless

there is clear user intent or the currently active application has

yielded this to the application that tries to activate itself. To

support activating windows in remote cocoa app shim processes, this

adds such a "yield" call when attempting to activate a window in a

remote process. Note that this only works if the currently active

process is chrome itself (and not for example some other app shim),

but that at least is enough for the common case of launching an app

from chrome://apps.

entry.title: [User Education] Add Per-App and Critical Notice IPH Modes
entry.content:
This CL adds a "promo subtype" to IPH which allows two new modes which can be applied to most IPH types:

- Per-App: This IPH can show once per App or PWA, and will not be

shown for that app once it is completed or dismissed.

- Legal Notice: This IPH can show any number of times until it is

dismissed; furthermore it takes precedence over any

non-legal-notice IPH (but not the legacy critical promos, or other

legal messaging). It does not show again once dismissed.



Certain types of IPH are not supported in these modes; specifically:

- Legacy (because nobody should be creating new legacy promos)

- Snooze (because the behavior is incompatible); note that other

IPH which would be snoozable now only have the "show me how" and

"got it" options.



In addition to adding these modes and a large number of tests to ensure they work correctly, this CL also adds auto-configuration and configuration consistency checks for these new promo subtypes.



These promos are still constrained by their Feature Engagement (FE) configuration, but the allowed FE configurations are much broader.



This CL also rearchitects some of the internals of FeaturePromoControllerCommon and FeaturePromoSnoozeService to offload specific IPH lifecycle tracking onto a new FeaturePromoLifecycle class. It also renames the stripped down snooze service to FeaturePromoStorageService, as it now stores all non-transient state information not already handled by feature_engagement::Tracker. These architectural changes not only enable the new behaviors, but also simplify the code and make the business logic much easier to read and understand.



Future work:

- Determine if we need a combination of the Per-App and Legal Notice subtype.

- Determine if we need a dismissal that times out (e.g. for a legal notice that must be shown once per year).



Note: Legal notices could theoretically be implemented via extremely specific FE configuration using unlimited trigger and limited used events, with the used event coming from certain kinds of bubble dismissal. However, this would force FE auto-configuration and make Finch much harder; instead I opted to use the existing snooze machinery.



Bug: 1479993, 1479773, 1482527

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix some inefficiencies in UserScript::Content.
entry.content:
This CL removes a TODO added by lazyboy@ added in 2016 which notes

that a std::string value can be moved into the UserScript::Content

class, since it's passed into the function by std::unique_ptr.



Specifically:



1. UserScript::Content::set_content now takes a std::string by value.



2. The function moves the value into its std::string data member.



3. There were places where removing the UTF-8 BOM used

std::string::substr. However, the strings themselves can be modified

in place using std::string::erase. This avoids making extra copies,

and removes a branch, reducing duplicated code.



4. UserScript::Content::set_external_content takes a

base::StringPiece by reference. It should just take the parameter by

value, since the recommendation is to pass it by value.

entry.title: windows-pen: fix single-tab-window drag
entry.content:
This change makes Tab ask HWNDMessageHandler to set a bool when the

pen is down on a tab. After the bool is set, HWNDMessageHandler will

let pen events fall through to the default handler until pen up.



This change fixes two issues with using pen/stylus in Chrome:

* a tab with a single window can't be moved by dragging the tab - it

moves only a few pixels then stops

* a tab can't be detached from a window to create a separate window -

a new window appears momentarily then disappears



This change fixes both of the above by allowing unhandled

WM_POINTERDOWN, WM_POINTERUP, and any pointer events in between to go

to the default window procedure, which is required for Windows to

drag-drop.



file with no unit test.

entry.title: [Policy] Add dark mode to chrome://policy and policy logs
entry.content:
To make the policy page more usable to every user, dark mode can help.

Many pages like settings and management already supports dark mode.

This will help in viewing the page in dark as well without going blind.



The same colours will apply to policy logs as well for sync.

The colours will automatically change based on system settings.



The CL also moves onto using variables which helps in code cleanup.

With this commit, the pages would be easier to look at and develop.



The color "google-grey-700" is used only once for the search bar only.

The reason it is used as a var is to keep it standard.

I.e. I'm stripping away the standard colours into their own variables.

Previously I had to assign them a label indicating which colour it is.

This is done in case Google changes the standard colour.

entry.title: [StyleBuilder] Make BaseData field_template:pointer, fix template
entry.content:
The BaseData field is a bit special, because it's the only

non-DataRef Member that exists top-level on ComputedStyle.

In a subsequent CL that refactors the ComputedStyle[Builder]

initialization, we'll need to store BaseData as a raw pointer

on the Builder. However, when using field_template:external,

the wrapper type gets baked into `field.type_name` by python code,

leaving no way to actually access the inner pointer type.

In other words, `field.type_name` returns "Member"

when we need it to return "StyleBaseData".



This can be fixed by using field_template:pointer, which leaves

`field.type_name` alone, and expects the templates to wrap

(or not wrap) depending on the situation.



This is also a good time to "modernize" pointer.tmpl, such that

it respects public/procted (if/when that's used in the future),

and generally uses as many utils from base.tmpl as possible.



There should be no behavior change in this CL.



Change-Id: I64d8b05f6069abaff5ba99f8d852be6271ef5a42

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4868380

entry.title: [Android Toolchain] Include lldb dependencies.
entry.content:
Running lldb client requires more libraries than previously included.

This CL updates the Android toolchain to copy these dependencies.

Relative to

toolchains/llvm/prebuilt/linux-x86_64/



in particular, getting lldb to work we'd minimally need:

bin/lldb.sh (main entrance point)

lib64/liblldb.*

lib64/libc++.*

lib64/libxml2.*

lib64/libedit.*

python3/



For robustness, we're also including:

lib64/lib*.*

lib64/python3/



For android_toolchain_canary, the lib64/ subdir (for NDK r25c) becomes

lib/ (currently NDK r27). The LIB variable in respective install.sh is

used to compensate for the difference.



Bug: 1266055

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Animate shrink and expand using Android animations
entry.content:
This change only applies for Start Surface Refactor Enabled.



Change the animations to run in Android rather than the compositor.



Improvements

* Approximately 50% FPS uplift.

* Correctly handles partially offscreen tab animations.

* Only requires 1 GPU readback cycle for shrink animation rather than 2.

* Composited layer is not used and dynamic resource is no longer

kept around. This should reduce memory usage (GPU?) and also prevent

"ghosting" of the tab switcher during orientation changes where a

single stale dynamic resource compositor frame might have shown.

* Tab Switcher will no longer force thumbnail updates so once

launched we can simplify getTabThumbnailWithCallback significantly.

* Start Surface Refactor currently doesn't show new tab animations at

all due to setting handlesTabCreating, but not doing anything for

onTabCreated. This CL "fixes" that behavior to better match the

pre-refactor UI.



Downsides

* Requires a custom new-tab animation as z-indexing between the

compositor and the Tab Switcher means the SimpleAnimationLayout

would be behind the Android UI.



Possible sources of issues

* Possible increased animation startup latency. This

will be monitored by metrics, but is capped at a timeout of 250 ms.

* Requires explicitly disabling touch input for the Tab Switcher during

animations (previously this was implicit due to the view being

invisible during animations). There is a risk this might cause touch

inputs to fail if the animation somehow gets interrupted and we get

into a bad state.



Follow-ups:

* New tab animation interacts weirdly with empty state. The empty

state appears "atop" the animation. I think this is due to

Android view z-indexing. I plan to fix this as a fast-follow.



Known issues that may not get fixed:

* Animations when thumbnails are of significantly different aspect

ratios may still look odd (although improved from current animations).

We could investigate skipping animations if the thumbnail is very

different in aspect ratio from the current viewport.

* Animations before a tab is fully loaded will skip and show no

thumbnail. This is correct since these tabs are not in a capturable

state. IMO this is better than showing a shrink animation with a

live layer then showing a blank thumbnail. However, it may feel like

a regression.

* New tab animation when changing between non-incognito and incognito

modes will change background color correctly, but will show the

wrong tabs in the tab switcher for the duration of the animation.

This is a longstanding issue AFAICT.



Demos:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1t4ugsq5VAOXx126eoB1pTWKOaTjNJ5Zi?usp=sharing



Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/15MynODfL6vimvD5O47-kFcGoTWQ0aQvnmpBIJVV5Md4/edit?usp=sharing



Low-Coverage-Reason: GtsRectAnimator has coverage for the animation running, but it isn't reflected in code coverage for some reason.

Bug: 1444782

Change-Id: I0ea779cddf93dc03a672f48eb5f20d31e0239644

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4585529

Reviewed-by: Sky Malice

entry.title: snap-groups: Record snap two windows duration
entry.content:
This adds metrics that will be used by Snap Groups. We want to record

the distribution of users snapping a first window then a second window

on the opposite side within X minutes, where X is very low.



If the first window is unsnapped or closed without a second window

getting snapped, we will record it as very high, i.e. the max bucket.



Note that this ignores partial ratios, if a user for some reason snaps

mismatched ratios (e.g. 2/3 left and 1/2 right), it will be recorded.



Test: added

Fixed: b/299666829

entry.title: ambient: update IsChargerConnected for Adaptive Charging
entry.content:
Currently, |IsChargerConnected()| returns true if the battery is

charging or has some charger connected when the battery level is >95%.

The second criteria will not be valid after the Adaptive Charging being

launched. The Adaptive Charging may pause charging even when the battery

is not fully charged.



When the battery is not being charged, we should instead check whether

an official, non-USB charger is connected, so that the battery is

either fully charged or charging is paused by Adaptive Charging.



BUG=None

TEST=ash_unittests --gtest_filter="*AmbientController*"

entry.title: Fix Private Aggregation null reports
entry.content:
Currently, Private Aggregation is denying budget for all requests with

a value sum of zero, i.e. null reports. Further, when budget is denied,

no report is ever sent (even if a context ID was specified).



This cl fixes this by skipping budget checks when the request is for

zero budget. Additionally, when a context ID was specified and budget is

denied, we replace the contributions with one null contribution instead

of dropping the report.



This behavior is gated behind a disabled-by-default feature param. So,

by default, this cl should not change any web visible behavior. We

plan to enable this feature in a separate cl (and add web tests when

doing that) after an I2S is approved.



See the corresponding spec change here:

https://github.com/patcg-individual-drafts/private-aggregation-api/pull/91



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Replaced with PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.Budgeter.RequestResult3, 09/2023



Bug: 1476512

entry.content:
remote shell



A new protocol was added for aura_shell that allows the client to

request a rounded window in this CL: crrev.com/c/4775627



One of the client to use this protocol is ARC++. ARC++ is migrating

from remote-shell to aura-shell, but the work is in progress so

we still need to use remote-shell for the old ARC++ versions.



Therefore to support rounded windows for older ARC++ versions, porting

the protocol to remote shell as well.

entry.title: Fix cold start detection for CustomTabs.Startup.TimeTo*
entry.content:
We can use the AppComponentFactory to figure out if Chrome was started

for an Activity or for something in the background, and ignore when

Chrome was already started for something in the background.



ContentProviders are somewhat complicated as Android always

initializes them when initializing the Application, but if we post a

task to set the reason to provider Android seems to always create the

Activity/Service, if one is being started, first.



how tests work. This is just for metrics so not worth the effort.

entry.title: Return specific SSL cert error from URLLoader
entry.content:
This change will allow SimpleUrlLoader::NetError() to return a more

specific cert error (between net::ERR_CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID and

net::ERR_CERT_KNOWN_INTERCEPTION_BLOCKED, or

ERR_SSL_PINNED_KEY_NOT_IN_CERT_CHAIN) other than

net::ERR_INSECURE_RESPONSE.
